result.execSummary:
The defendant Allison A Bronaugh Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC AMENDED FROM Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Fine to be paid on payment plan of $50/month to begin 07/01/15. 10 Days RCJ for failure to pay. 
Defendant must also pay outstanding ZCI fees.

6/17/15 - AMENDED TO REFLECT Credit for Time Served

Racine County Pretrial Screening Report
Preliminary hearing on March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Allison A Bronaugh in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant Allison A Bronaugh in custody.  Noah Michael Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
